history.content:
Hi all,

I’m an instructor for Juni Learning, which is an online program that teaches kids ages 8-18 the fundamentals of computer science, and we’re looking to hire a few teachers for this school year!

Teachers have flexible hours and can set their availability on a semester basis. Each session is 50 minutes, taught online, and teachers use the curriculum and teacher portal developed by Juni. We expect most teachers to work 4-10 hours per week, and teachers can earn $20-25+ / hour based on performance. We’re looking for teachers that have taken CS 61A or equivalent and, most importantly, enjoy working with younger students and building their interest in CS.

Please reach out to careers@learnwithjuni.com if you’re interested, and we’ll provide you with more details!

--

Obviously that's just a message I'm passing on, but in complete honesty, this is a really neat opportunity. It's pretty fun and really rewarding if you enjoy teaching. In my experience, normal part time jobs interfere with school a ton but this doesn't at all. I just squeeze a 50 minute lesson between classes, and get paid instead of just wasting my time on YouTube or whatever.
history.subject: Teaching opportunity
